title: pocl 0.14 install fails
body:
Building OpenCL via `pocl` fails on creating a symlink as of e5560dfbdee0235f6f727071cec968fd4913fab4

```bash
spack install pocl

==> Building pocl [CMakePackage]
==> Executing phase : 'cmake'
==> Executing phase : 'build'
==> Executing phase : 'install'
==> Error: OSError: [Errno 17] File exists
/home/axel/src/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/pocl/package.py:95, in symlink_opencl:
     92       @run_after('install')
     93       def symlink_opencl(self):
     94           with working_dir(self.build_directory):
  >> 95               os.symlink("OpenCL", join_path(self.prefix.include, "CL"))
```

The stage looks like this:
```bash
$ ls include/CL/
cl2.hpp  cl_egl.h  cl_ext.h  cl_gl_ext.h  cl_gl.h  cl.h  cl.hpp  cl.hpp.in  cl.hpp.patched  cl_platform.h  CMakeLists.txt  opencl.h
$ ls include/OpenCL/
cl_ext.h  cl_gl_ext.h  cl_gl.h  cl.h  cl.hpp  cl_platform.h  opencl.h
```

But in the installed directory the `OpenCL` symlink is missing if I blindly comment out those lines.
